name: woolliness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being confused and not clear, and not having been considered carefully enough: The resolutions have a certain woolliness to them. The newspaper was critical of governmental woolliness, urging the prime minister to clarify her position. See
woolly
More examplesFewer examplesIt suits the organization to have a degree of woolliness about the rules. Like a lot of what he says, it is high in woolliness and short on precision. The woolliness of the principles that the party published this week would previously have had opponents mocking its superficiality.
